title: Training Accuracy 90%, Prediction Accuracy 0.3% ?
body:
Hey There, great tool! Have a question though that I can't seem to figure out. 

I trained a model using a sample data set for banking information which takes in customer demographics and has a binary "purchase" column of whether they purchased a certificate of deposit or not (1 or 0). Trying to make a prediction for future customers on that column based on the same.

I trained my model and have a 90% accuracy after 20 epochs.

![screen shot 2019-02-19 at 11 47 17 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14937052/53032336-ab695580-343c-11e9-886b-e422e6e1d879.png)

But when I run a predict on a single datapoint with the **--only_predictions** flag. I get a prediction of "False" which is correct (I just used one of the data points from the set for a manual test), **but I got a probability of 0.0033177494 which is very low for a 90% testing accuracy**

![screen shot 2019-02-19 at 11 49 47 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14937052/53032476-ebc8d380-343c-11e9-800a-8611c6bd90ae.png)

**Am I doing something wrong or misinterpreting something?**

train.csv

```
age,job,marital,education,default,housing,loan,contact,month,day_of_week,duration,campaign,pdays,previous,poutcome,emp_var_rate,cons_price_idx,cons_conf_idx,euribor3m,nr_employed,purchase
44,blue-collar,married,basic.4y,unknown,yes,no,cellular,aug,thu,210,1,999,0,nonexistent,1.4,93.444,-36.1,4.963,5228.1,0
```

predict.csv (same thing, just without the 'purchase' column)
```
age,job,marital,education,default,housing,loan,contact,month,day_of_week,duration,campaign,pdays,previous,poutcome,emp_var_rate,cons_price_idx,cons_conf_idx,euribor3m,nr_employed
56,unemployed,married,basic.9y,unknown,no,yes,telephone,may,tue,43,2,999,0,nonexistent,1.1,93.994,-36.4,4.856,5191
```
